events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their car on April 30, 2024, causing moderate vehicle damage.
The claim has been categorised as an Auto Accident based on keywords and description of the car collision.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the customerâ€™s vehicle accident claim and all related correspondence.
Customer received official acknowledgement of their car accident claim submission with a reference number.
The insurance company requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates for claim processing.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including clear photos of the collision damage and official police report.
Assigned investigator began reviewing submitted documents and contacted repair shops for vehicle assessment.
Investigation concluded confirming the damage is consistent with the reported car collision and approved coverage.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer outlining reimbursement for car repairs and towing expenses.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the claim handling process.
The claim was formally approved following customer acceptance of the proposed settlement terms.
Insurance company issued payment for the approved amount covering vehicle repair costs and associated fees.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after successful payment issuance and customer confirmation.
